abstract.p: Kate MacGregor letter on October 15 and December 10 articles on carbon offsets and eco-tourism

block.p: To the Editor: Regarding ''Carbon Neutral: Raising the Ante on Eco-Tourism'' (Buzzword of the Year, Dec. 10): although Michelle Higgins discussed third-party verification of carbon offsets in her Practical Traveler article on Oct. 15, she did not mention it in this piece. Clean Air--Cool Planet (www.cleanair-coolplanet.org) recently published a report evaluating 30 offset providers.

The report reveals the top eight providers while cautioning that ''the market is still catching up with public interest,'' and that it's difficult for even environmentally savvy consumers to be able to judge the difference in product quality.

To the Editor: Regarding ''Carbon Neutral: Raising the Ante on Eco-Tourism'' (Buzzword of the Year, Dec. 10): although Michelle Higgins discussed third-party verification of carbon offsets in her Practical Traveler article on Oct. 15, she did not mention it in this piece. Clean Air--Cool Planet (www.cleanair-coolplanet.org) recently published a report evaluating 30 offset providers.

The report reveals the top eight providers while cautioning that ''the market is still catching up with public interest,'' and that it's difficult for even environmentally savvy consumers to be able to judge the difference in product quality.
Instead of another article on how to reduce the travel consumer's guilt, the newspaper should consider an article on reducing climate-changing travel emissions.
